author: Reformer Staff
title: New activities begin this week
text:
New activities begin this week 
Reformer Staff Posted: 10/19/2015 07:28:05 PM EDT Updated: 10/19/2015 07:28:07 PM EDT 
BRATTLEBORO >> The Brattleboro Recreation & Parks Department has announced that the Nelson E. Withington Skating Facility will be opening for the season on Saturday, Oct. 24. 
The daily public skating rates at the rink are: $3 for Brattleboro students, $4 for Brattleboro adults, $4 for students that are not Brattleboro residents and $5 for adults that are not Brattleboro residents. 
The weekly schedule looks like this: Mondays — 7 p.m. to 9 p.m., Tuesdays — 10:30 a.m. to noon (adults only), Wednesdays — 10:30 a.m. to noon (adults only), Fridays — 10:30 a.m. to noon (adults only) and 7 p.m. to 9 p.m., Saturdays — 1:30 p.m. to 4 p,m. (Dollar Day) and 7 p.m. to 9 p.m., Sundays — 1:45-4:45 p.m., 7-9 p.m. and 9:15-10:15 p.m. (adults only). Stick Time 
This will also begin at Withing Skating Facility on Oct. 24. Helmets and gloves are required. This is your opportunity to skate and shoot some pucks. 
Stick Time is offered on Wednesdays from 3-4:30 p.m. and Saturdays from 12:15-1:15 p.m. 
The fees are: Students — $3 for residents and $4 for non residents. Adults — $4 for residents and $5 for non residents. Stick Time fees are not included in season passes. Zumba 
Thursday evening classes will be offered at the Rec Dept. from Oct. 22 to April 28. Zumba is the Latin Dance Fitness program that's getting the whole world moving to international rhythms and Latin beats. It will be run by Licensed Zumba Fitness Instructor Emily Mcloughlin. The classes will be held from 5:30-6:30 each Thursday night. The fees are: $5 per class for residents and $7 per class for non residents, or $50 for residents and $70 for non residents if you want the 10-session punch card. Advertisement Skating Rink Birthday Parties 
Reservations are being taken for Skating Rink Birthday Parties at the Withington arena. A party may be booked during any hours that the Public Skating is scheduled. Reservations and payment must be made at the Brattleboro Recreation & Parks Department, 207 Main Street, one-week prior to the date of the scheduled event. The fee for the party is $100, which includes 10 skating admissions, 10 skate rentals, a room to have refreshments in, and a 9x13" decorated birthday cake. Gymnasium Birthday Parties 
Reservations are being taken for Birthday Parties in the gymnasium at the Gibson Aiken Center. The cost is $100, which includes a cake, basketballs, kickballs, wiffleball set and bases and use of the Large Conference Room for the cake, snacks and presents. A party size of 10-12 is recommended. Rental time is Saturdays from 3-5 p.m. (includes set up and cleanup time). Reservations and payment must be made at the Recreation & Parks Department Office located at 207 Main Street, at least 10 days prior to the scheduled event. The Rec Dept. requires a refundable deposit of $75 for each reservation. Adult Coed Volleyball 
The Rec Dept. is sponsoring Adult (out of high school) Coed Volleyball on Thursday evenings at the Gibson-Aiken Center, from 7-8:30 p.m. This eight-week session will begin on Oct. 22 and run through April 28. The cost per night is $3 for Brattleboro residents and $5 for non residents or there is a new 10-session punch card available for residents at $30 and non residents at $55. This punch card be also used for Badminton and Indoor Soccer. The program is for all levels of players who want to gain knowledge, experience and improve on their game. Sneakers must be worn in order to participate. Adult Badminton 
The Rec Dept. will sponsor an Adult Coed Badminton program which will be held in the Gibson-Aiken Center on Thursdays from 5:30-7 p.m. starting Oct. 22, and will run through April 28. This program is designed for adults (18 and older) of all abilities and is a great way to meet new people with the same interest while improving on your game. It is a freelance program with no instructor. Pick-up games will be played. Participants must wear sneakers and bring their own racquet. The cost per night is $3 for Brattleboro residents and $5 for non residents or there is a new 10-session punch card available for residents at $30 and non residents at $55. This punch card can also be used for Volleyball and Indoor Soccer. Adult Indoor Soccer 
The Rec Dept. will host a Coed Adult Indoor Soccer Program. This program will be on Tuesday nights from 7-8:30 starting today and running through April 26. Participants of all abilities ages 18 and up are welcome. Pick-up games will take place in the Gibson-Aiken Center Gym. There will be no teams or officials. Indoor balls and pinnies will be provided. The cost per night is $3 for Brattleboro residents and $5 for non residents or there is a new 10-session punch card available for residents at $30 and non residents at $55. This punch card be also used for Volleyball and Badminton. Players are asked to wear shin guards and clean, appropriate footwear. Registration will take place tonight, but others are welcome to join at any time if space is available. Ping Pong Club 
The Brattleboro Area Table Tennis Club will be meeting Tuesday nights on the Third Floor of the Gibson-Aiken Center, from 6-8:30 p.m. starting today and running through April 26. Players of all skill levels are encouraged to attend. The Club will have open games and will occasionally provide lessons. Kids are welcome on the first Tuesday of the month. If you have questions, contact Sandy Shriver at 802-257-7244 X114 or by email at ashriver@pottestewartlaw.com . The cost per night is $2 for Brattleboro residents and $3 for non residents or there is a new 10-session punch card available for residents at $20 and non residents at $30. Discounted Rink Passes 
If you're interested in a discounted rink pass at Nelson E. Withington Skating Facility, they will be on sale until Oct. 22 at 4 p.m. The prices are: Students — $36 (residents) and $49.50 (non residents), Adults — $45 (residents) and $58.50 (non residents), and Family — $72 (residents) and $94.50 (non residents). 
If there are special needs required for any of the above programs or more information is needed, call the Recreation & Parks Department at 802-254-5808. The Gibson-Aiken Center is handicap accessible. Check out the Rec's website for a complete listing/description of events at www.brattleboro.org .
